definition[0]: to suddenly experience a difficult or unpleasant situation, or to make someone or something do this
example[0]: A strike would plunge the country into chaos.
example[1]: The house was suddenly plunged into darkness.
example[2]: After the war, the family plunged into debt.
definition[1]: to begin to do something suddenly, without thinking about the possible results
example[3]: Investors are plunging into the world of international bonds.
definition[2]: to start to experience a difficult or unpleasant situation, or to make someone or something start to experience it
example[4]: After the war, Europe plunged into recession.
example[5]: A disastrous Christmas period plunged the company into a cash crisis.
